DNF
public class Disjunction<E extends Expression>
extends java.util.ArrayList<E>
implements Expression

List of expressions as an OR combination.

isDnf

public boolean isDnf()

deMorganToDNF

protected static DNF deMorganToDNF(Expression deMorganed)
Convenience function to format Expression tree into Disjunctive Normal Form. It assumes that the expression has been formatted with the de Morgan function, such that all NOTs are only at the leaves.

Parameters:
deMorganed -
Returns:

toDisjunctionRecurse

protected static void toDisjunctionRecurse(Expression expression,
                                           Reason trace,
                                           DNF traces)
Recursively adds to the Disjunction traces. As it traverses the expression tree, it either adds to trace, or creates new traces

Parameters:
expression - tree to walk
trace - to add to trace if appending a conjunction
traces - to add new Disjunctions to

toCollapsed

public static Expression toCollapsed(Expression expression)
Collapses Conjunctions and Disjunctions if they only have one child.

Parameters:
expression -
Returns:

toDNF

public static DNF toDNF(Expression expression)
Converts expression fully to DNF. Note that resulting traces do not have disjunctions. All disjunctions (OR) have been propagated to the top and are separated. Flattens to at most 2-3 layers: Disjunction of (Conjunctions or NOT(terminal) or terminal Expressions)

Parameters:
expression -
Returns:

isSatisfiedBy

public boolean isSatisfiedBy(Expression other)
TODO: currently the same as for Conjunction; not sure if that is ok, or this should just be invalid

Specified by:
isSatisfiedBy in interface Expression
Parameters:
other - should generally be "smaller" (i.e. contains less information) than this.
Returns:
